panels.description: Total number of times consumer groups have had to rebalance partitions. This can indicate instability in the cluster or consumer groups.
panels.title: Total Groups Rebalancing

panels.description: Total number of partitions across all topics. More partitions can increase throughput but also add complexity.
panels.title: Total Number of Partitions

panels.description: Average size of log segments for each topic. This can impact performance and storage usage.
panels.title: Log Segment Size By Topic

panels.description: Total number of errors encountered while fetching metadata. This could indicate issues with the Zookeeper quorum or network connectivity.
panels.title: Metadata Error Count

panels.description: Total number of bytes received by the broker, including messages and control messages.
panels.title: Total Bytes In

panels.description: Total number of bytes sent by the broker, including messages and responses to consumers.
panels.title: Total Bytes Out

panels.description: Average time taken for messages to be processed by each topic. High latency could indicate overloaded brokers or slow consumers.
panels.title: Message Latency By Topic

panels.description: Total number of messages consumed from each topic. This can help you understand data flow through your Kafka cluster.
panels.title: Total Messages Consumed Per Topic

panels.description: Total number of messages produced to each topic. This can help you understand data ingestion rates.
panels.title: Total Messages Produced Per Topic

panels.description: This metric indicates the number of active Kafka controller nodes in the cluster. The Kafka controller is responsible for managing cluster metadata and coordinating actions such as leader election and partition reassignment
panels.title: Active Controller Count

panels.description: This metric measures the memory usage of the Java Virtual Machine (JVM) running Kafka brokers. It provides insights into how much memory is allocated to different memory pools within the JVM, such as heap memory and non-heap memory. Monitoring JVM memory usage is essential for preventing out-of-memory errors and maintaining the stability of Kafka brokers.
panels.title: JVM Memory Pool Bytes

panels.description: This metric measures the total CPU processing time consumed by Kafka brokers over a specified period, typically in seconds. Monitoring CPU usage provides insights into the computational workload of Kafka brokers and helps identify potential performance bottlenecks or resource constraints.
panels.title: Total CPU Process in Seconds

panels.description: This metric tracks the total number of failed fetch requests from consumers to brokers within the Kafka cluster. Failed fetch requests may indicate issues with network connectivity, broker overload, or consumer misconfiguration.
panels.title: Total Failed Fetch Requests

panels.description: This metric indicates the percentage of disk space utilized by Kafka brokers. Monitoring broker disk usage is crucial for ensuring that there is sufficient storage capacity to handle incoming data. High disk usage may lead to performance degradation and potential data loss if not addressed promptly.
panels.title: Broker Disk Usage

panels.description: This metric indicates the number of partitions in the Kafka cluster that are under-replicated, meaning they do not have the required number of replicas as specified by the replication factor.
panels.title: Under-Replicated Partitions Count

panels.description: This metric represents the number of partitions in the Kafka cluster that are currently offline or unavailable. Offline partitions may occur due to various reasons, such as broker failures or network issues.
panels.title: Offline Partitions Count

panels.description: Similar to the maximum lag metric, this metric provides the lag for each partition within a consumer group.
panels.title: Consumer Group Partition Lag

panels.description: This metric provides the maximum lag across all partitions for each consumer group.
panels.title: Consumer Group Maximum Lag

panels.description: This metric provides the current offset (position) of the consumer within each partition.
panels.title: Consumer Group Current Offset

panels.description: This metric calculates the lag in seconds for each partition within a consumer group.
panels.title: Consumer Group Lag in Seconds

panels.description: This metric provides information about the partition assignment strategy used by each consumer group, helping you understand how partitions are distributed among consumers.
panels.title: Consumer Group Partition Assignment Strategy
